Package model

Class Grid

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Grid
  • public class Grid
extends java.lang.Object
    This class houses a variety of methods belonging to the game "grid" as a whole including the weapon slots, player board, and so forth. It communicates directly with controller.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Grid

        public Grid​(int iD,
            ServerInterface server)
        Creates a new grid. This is called as soon as a new game is created. Needs to be linked to the server so notify methods function properly.
        Parameters:
        iD - game id
        server - server

      • damage

        public void damage​(Player p,
                   Player p1,
                   int numDamage)
            throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Adds a number of player p's damage tokens to target player p1's player board. Further condition if p1 is overkilled. Also saves notify information.
        Parameters:
        p - player (self)
        p1 - target player
        numDamage - amount of damage dealt
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - RMI exception

      • move

        public void move​(Player p,
                 int d)
          throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Moves a player in some direction and adds notify information. As a reminder, 1 = up, 2 = right, 3 = down, 4 = left.
        Parameters:
        p - player
        d - direction
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - RMI exception

      • isThereAWall

        public boolean isThereAWall​(Player p,
                            Position pT)
        Determines whether or not there is a wall separating a player from a cell. Note that cell.posWalls is of type int[] and as such listPosWalls.contains checks for integer.
        Parameters:
        p - player
        pT - cell position
        Returns:
        boolean

      • isThereAWall

                            Position pT2)
        Determines whether or not there is a wall separating two cells.
        Parameters:
        pT1 - cell position 1
        pT2 - cell position 2
        Returns:
        boolean

      • isInTheRoom

        boolean isInTheRoom​(Player p,
                    Player p1)
        Determines whether or not two players are in the same room (by its colour alone).
        Parameters:
        p - player
        p1 - other player
        Returns:
        boolean

      • isInViewZone

        public boolean isInViewZone​(Player p,
                            Player p1)
        Determines whether or not player p can "see" another player p1, i.e. p1 lies within p's view zone. Note that this method is not symmetric, so player p1 may not necessarily see p even though p sees him.
        Parameters:
        p - player
        p1 - other player
        Returns:
        boolean

      • isInViewZone

        public boolean isInViewZone​(Player p,
                            Position pos)
        Determines whether or not a cell is in a player's view zone.
        Parameters:
        p - player
        pos - cell position
        Returns:
        boolean

      • pickPowerUpCard

        public void pickPowerUpCard​(Player p)
        Draws a powerup card which is added to the player's deck. This method should be used every time a player wants a PowerUpCard, except for the final "pick and discard" when he is dead.
        Parameters:
        p - player

      • pickPowerUpCard

        public PowerUpCard pickPowerUpCard()
        Draws a powerup card which is added to the player's deck. This method should be used for the final "pick and discard" when the player is dead.
        Returns:
        powerup card

      • ghostMove

        public Player ghostMove​(Player p,
                        java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> directions)
        A "ghost move" is used in certain card effects to mock an imaginary player's movement. It does not affect the game itself.
        Parameters:
        p - player
        directions - direction list
        Returns:
        ghost player
